intro: Inula lineata, commonly known as the blueweed or yellow gentian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional herbal remedies. Inula lineata is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
